content.description: Start as for "Breakfast at Cliffany's" on the left facing flake. Bump up and right to a far gaston, adjust feet and reach for the arching crimp rail above the gaston. Match the arching crimp rail and follow mossy slightly incut edges up over the bulge.

Start matching the large sidepull flake and move up to the left hand crimp. Afterwards move up to a solid righthand crimp before throwing to the top lip. A much easier version of this line is possible by using the large crack between the last crimp and the top, but it was much less fun.
content.protection: 1 pad and a spotter. The landing is on a steep hill so its difficult to get good protection with just a pad.
content.location: This climb is directly to the left of grippy gully. The start hold can be found by following the lip of the grippy gully start to the right.

content.description: Climb the featured slab left of Breakfast at Cliffany's

Sit start with hands in flake and feet far left. Pull up to two good edges, find feet, and then pull up to a right hand on your choice of a glassy crimp, a tiny bad Gaston pocket, or a bad slope. Set feet and then launch for the jugs above the bulge. Try not to dry fire off the glassy crimp, it hurts.
content.location: Down the hill to the left of "Breakfast at Cliffany's"

content.description: Start up that the horizontal crack in the featured concave slabby rock. Trust your feet to smearing and work your way up the well featured face.
content.location: To the right of "Core Shot Club"

content.description: Start on a small left facing flake at about chest height work up on good crimps and small edges into a corner dihedralish feature. Top out and walk off. Tall and scarier than it is difficult. Really good quality rock, not sure what it is though.
content.location: Sort of hard to pinpoint. You'll see the outcropping of rocks from shelmire road. This is on the tall face of the outcropping closest to Uwchlan Hunt.

content.description: Start with hands in the large left facing flake to the right of "Tripping While Dogsitting" and with good feet. Layback up and get some crimps to pull over the bulge. The crack is home to a myriad of spiders in the warm months.

This is a shaded area with a small amount of climbable bouldering problems on rocky fins on a hillside. There are several different fins and isolated boulders along this hill, however many are not worth climbing or the landings are too steep/ rocky to be worth a lot of effort.
